question: I have been diagnosed with Hep-C and Diabetes within the last 6 months.My new doctor found out that I had been put on Glyburide and he switched meto Glucophage because the other was not good for my liver. I started gettingdizzy spells within the first 2 days so I read the precautions and it said notto take it if I have liver problems. Something about Lactic Acidosis and how itcould      me.What can I take that is safe for my diabetes?Also what can I take for aches & pains that won't hurt my liver?Tylenol, Ibuprofen, OK?_________________________Dear Bob,It is difficult to advise you as to an oral medicine for diabetes that would be 100% safe for your liver.  In general, liver toxicity due to drugs is rare and for the most part would have nothing to do with the fact you have hepatitis c.  The risk of any medication to the liver is more dependent on the degree of liver damage that you have rather than the cause of your liver disease.I would suggest that treating your diabetes is important and you should find a medication, with the help of your physician, that controls your blood sugar and has tolerable side effects.  I would suggest he/she monitor your liver functions periodically while on the medication to watch for any possible side effects to the liver.As far as pain medication goes, anything you take in moderation is likely OK.  If you have to take something several times a day for longer than a day, you need to talk to your physician because Tylenol or Motrin could begin to do damage if taken in large quantities.  Ultram may be a good choice as it is relatively safe for the liver and kidneys.This information is presented for educational purposes only.  Always consult your physician for specific medical issues.HFHSM.D.-kb*keywords: hepatitis, diabetes mellitus0.2
